oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: |a!kunta (Stoffel) (I)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Accounting for the habits of animals, in which various animals marry their own kind, eat certain things and behave in certain ways, because the Anteater tells them to. We have a separate version of these laws or sayings of the Anteater and Lynx. (L I.-2. 138-150.) 1) p.147v: the hyena is said to carry eggs in its mane, 2) See also The Anteater, Springbok and Lynx (||kabbo's versions 1 & 2), 3) This story is found in Book I-2.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Anteater's laws (|a!kunta's version)
